newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Sapec says in bid to control Quimigal fertiliser.
newsitem.headline: Sapec says in bid to control Quimigal fertiliser.

text.p: Belgian holding company Sapec SA said on Monday it had taken part in the privatisation of Portugese chemicals company Quimigal with a view to gaining control over Quimigal's fertiliser arm.

Portuguese firm Quimigest, in which Sapec is a partner, won the bidding for a 90 percent stake in Quimigal-Quimica de Portugal SA with an 8.14 billion escudo offer on Thursday. The deal will give Sapec 25 percent in Quimigal in a first phase.

Before the end of the year Sapec would sell that stake back to the Mello group, which owned 75 percent of Quimigest-Sociedade Quimica de Prestacao de Servicos, in return for 49 percent in Quimigal Adubos, Quimigal's fertiliser arm.
The transaction would raise Sapec's investment to 2.47 billion escudos (510 million francs) from some two billion escudos for the initial 25 percent stake.
